title.narrative: Cabo Delgado Acute Crisis Joint Response (CDG JR)

description.narrative: Response to vulnerable IDPs in North Mozambique esp. food aid, livelihoods support (seeds, hoes) and WASH interventies. Cooperation with FH local partner AMA

transaction.ref: Cabo Delgado Acute Crisis Joint Response (CDG JR): € 14.738,00 (13-5-21)

title.narrative: Capacity Building (localisation)
% of budget spent on capacity building of national an local actors

comment.narrative: % of budget spent on capacity building of national an local actors
13 staff comprising of 7 from AMA and 6 from FH participated in the capacity building work shop

title.narrative: National and local actors
% of budget that went to national and local actors

comment.narrative: % of budget that went to national and local actors
Carrying out community engagement activities, as well as implementing FSC and WASH activities

title.narrative: Adaptations to JR
Number of adaptations in the design and/or implementation of the JR, as a result of the input from beneficiaries.

comment.narrative: Number of adaptations in the design and/or implementation of the JR, as a result of the input from beneficiaries.
The DRAJR was extended with 1 month of NON-cost extension till 13 december 2021

title.narrative: Participation
Number of crisis-affected people who are also involved in the design, implementation, monitoring and/or evaluation of the programme

comment.narrative: Number of crisis-affected people who are also involved in the design, implementation, monitoring and/or evaluation of the programme
Carry out Post-Distribution Monitoring after distribution of food, vegetable seeds and WASH materials (hygiene and dignity kits) and supporting in managing distributions

WASH Committee members and Community Based Management committees were actively involved in the distribution of food kits, WASH NFIs and concrete latrine slabs. The PDM will be conducted in the next reporting period. A Post Distribution Monitoring survey was conducted during which 192 HHs were interviewed.
Carry out Post-Distribution Monitoring after distribution of food, vegetable seeds and WASH materials (hygiene and dignity kits) and supporting in managing distributions

WASH Committee members and Community Based Management committees were actively involved in the distribution of food kits, WASH NFIs and concrete latrine slabs. The PDM will be conducted in the next reporting period. A Post Distribution Monitoring survey was conducted during which 192 HHs were interviewed.

title.narrative: Capacity Building (reach)
Number of national and local actors supported with capacity-building

comment.narrative: Number of national and local actors supported with capacity-building
A workshop with the aim of capacitating FH project Staff and partners (AMA) took place at the beginning of the project. This adsressed and equipped all project staff on achieving the desired results.

title.narrative: Availability of, access to and consumption of food
Number of people enabled to meet their basic food needs

comment.narrative: Number of people enabled to meet their basic food needs
650 HHs received their 1st and 2nd cycle food kits while 1214 HHs received their 2nd cycle food kits during the reporting quarter.

Procurement and distribution of 2 months of food vouchers to 1666 IDP HHs
The first cycle of the two contemplated distributions was done as planned to a total of 1214 households with the communities of Nacuta, Unidade and Muaja benefiting with 503HH, 365HH and 346HH respectively. In terms of beneficiaries Nacuta has 2769, Unidade has 1762 and Muaja has 1499, thus giving us a grand sum of 6030 beneficiries. FH local partner AMA will be distributing in the District of Ancuabe in July 2021, targeting 650 households as direct beneficiaries with 3250 individuals. In terms of accomplishment the current sum of 6030 represents an achievement of 72%
Q4: 650 HHs received their 1st and 2nd cycle food kits while 1214 HHs received their 2nd cycle food kits during the reporting quarter.
Procurement and distribution of 2 months of food vouchers to 1666 IDP HHs

title.narrative: Excreta disposal
Number of people having access to dignified, safe, clean and functional excreta disposal facilities

comment.narrative: Number of people having access to dignified, safe, clean and functional excreta disposal facilities
Promote self-construction of 1666 HH latrines through distribution of latrine slabs . 1121 concrete slabs were distributed in both districts. 650 slabs distributed in the month of October 2021.
Promote self-construction of 1666 HH latrines through distribution of latrine slabs. 1121 concrete slabs were distributed in both districts. 650 slabs distributed in the month of October 2021.

title.narrative: Water supply
Number of people having access to sufficient and safe water for domestic use

comment.narrative: Number of people having access to sufficient and safe water for domestic use
in Q3-Construction (2) and rehabilitation (5) of seven boreholes and construction of one water system

Construction (2) and rehabilitation (5) of seven boreholes and construction of one water system. The construction of a water system was finalised at Nacuta community and 2 boreholes sccessfully rehabilitated at Muaja. 2 new boreholes were constructed in Muaja and Unidade communities and 6 non-functioning boreholes were successfully rehabilitated in Unidade (1) and Mahera (5).
in Q3-Construction (2) and rehabilitation (5) of seven boreholes and construction of one water system

title.narrative: Hygiene promotion
Number of people having regular access to soap to meet hygienic needs

comment.narrative: Number of people having regular access to soap to meet hygienic needs

Distribution of hygiene/Covid-19 kits, cholera prevention kits and dignity kits. Dignity kits were distributed to a total of 1771 HHs (479 in Nacuta, 321 Unidade, 321 Muaja, 325 Mahera and 325 Nanjua-A)

title.narrative: Short-term livelihood support
Number of people provided with resources to protect and start rebuilding livelihood assets

comment.narrative: Number of people provided with resources to protect and start rebuilding livelihood assets

Procurement and distribution of vegetable seeds (cabbage, tomato and covo-10g each) and a hoe to 1666 IDP HHs
The seeds and hoes distribution was done just on time to allow the beneficiaries to make use of these seeds during the current vegetable season. In the communities of Nacuta 479 benefited, Unidade 321 benefited and Muaja 321 benefited. This translates to 2624 indirect beneficiaries, 1604 for Unidade and 1421 for Muaja. In terms of achievement this represents an accomplishment of 68%. FH partner AMA will distribute seeds /hoes in July 2021 and this will be reported in Quarter 3. 650 HHs seed kits and farming tools were distributed in Q4

Procurement and distribution of vegetable seeds (cabbage, tomato and covo/cabbage-10g each) and a hoe to 1666 IDP HHs

title.narrative: Hygiene promotion (Awareness)
Number of people reached with hygiene promotion/awareness raising activities

comment.narrative: Number of people reached with hygiene promotion/awareness raising activities
Routine hygiene promotion messaging during community gatherings (distributions of food, vegetable seeds,hygiene and dignity kits)

Routine hygiene promotion messaging during community gatherings (distributions of food, vegetable seeds, hygiene and dignity kits)
During the food distribution in the communities of Nacuta, Unidade and Muaja beneficiaries were sensitized with hygiene promotion messages before commencing with the actual distribution. The messaging was on hand washing and COVID-19 prevention messaging. All the 1214 beneficiaries of foodkits participated in this exercise. This is an ongoing and continuous activity that is done routinely whenever the project is carrying out a distribution. During the distribution of the hygiene kits and dignity kits in the communities of Nacuta, Unidade, Muaja, Mahera and Nanjua-A, beneficiaries were sensitized with hygiene promotion messages before commencing with the actual distribution. Key messages included handwashing and COVID-19 prevention messaging. All the 1864 beneficiaries of dignity kits from FH and AMA participated in this exercise.
